title: Ticket #5698: Add GAHP statistics to grid ads
description:
Add some statistics about GAHP commands to the Grid ads advertised by the gridmanager. The stats will be collected by the GahpServer object and reported by each Resource object.

Since multiple Resource objects may share the same GAHP server, multiple Grid ads may have stats for the same GAHP. The stats are for all commands handled by that GAHP server, not just commands involving a specific Resource's service. Detecting which Grid ads share a GAHP can be done by examining the new GahpPid attribute.

Some GAHPs are not represented, because no Resource object uses them. For example, the nordugrid_gahp used to do file transfers for cream jobs.

These are the new statistics

  • GahpCommandsIssued Total number of commands issued, plus a Recent count
  • GahpCommandsTimedOut Total number of commands that the gridmanager timed out, plus a Recent count.
  • GahpCommandsInFlight Current number of commands issued, plus a Peak count. This is commands issued for which the gridmanager is awaiting a result (does not include timed out commands).
  • GahpCommandsQueued Current number of commands waiting to be issued (not issued yet due to throttles), plus a Peak count.
  • GahpCommandRuntime Stats on time it took for commands to complete in the GAHP, including average, min, max, std.dev., and sum. Both lifetime and Recent.

If the gridmanager times out a command (due to GRIDMANAGER_GAHP_CALL_TIMEOUT), the runtime of the command is GRIDMANAGER_GAHP_CALL_TIMEOUT. Timed out commands do not count in GahpCommandsIssued. We may want to change this behavior.
